--- Ian Badcoe <ian_badcoe@...> wrote:

> Hi,
> 	Is there any advice people have to offer if I'm
> going to start some 
> serious NEAT coding?
> 
> 	I want to work in C++ on Windows, but I'll probably
> want to stay away from 
> platform specific issues like user interfaces and
> graphics output, so I'm 
> pretty confident I can keep away from nasty build
> problems and suchlike 
> arising from those.

I recommend that you see what NEAT can do in
navigating a virtual sailboat.  Of course I'm talking
about the one you will find in the SailChallenge
software on the annevolve website.  That requires a
controller to respond to the local environment and set
the sails and rudder.  An ANN that does that is
included with SailChallenge.  You can just replace it
with yours.

An example of neuroevolution applied to creating such
an ANN is found in the EvSail software.

<snip>

Mitchell Timin
http://annevolve.sourceforge.net
